<![CDATA[CBC | Technology News ]]> http://www.cbc.ca/technology/?cmp=rss en-ca Sun, 18 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST CBC.ca http://www.cbc.ca/rss/image/cbc_144.gif http://www.cbc.ca/news/?cmp=rss <![CDATA[Neptune's mysterious storm shrinking out of existence]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/neptune-storm-disappearing-1.4539220?cmp=rss 1.4539220 Sun, 18 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST CBC News News/Technology & Science

Like Jupiter's Great Red Spot, Neptune has had its own raging storm. Astronomers using Hubble have discovered that this once-enormous storm is rapidly shrinking.

]]> <![CDATA[Starman and his Tesla could crash into Earth or Venus ... eventually]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/musk-tesla-roadster-crash-earth-1.4537407?cmp=rss 1.4537407 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST Nicole Mortillaro News/Technology & Science

Bad news, Elon: There's a chance your Tesla Roadster will come crashing down to Earth.

]]> <![CDATA[Borneo's orangutans at risk of extinction after population decreases by 148,500 in 16 years]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/100000-orangutans-borneo-lost-1.4528710?cmp=rss 1.4528710 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 12:00:00 EST Nicole Mortillaro News/Technology & Science

Partly due to deforestation and the rise of industrial plantations, Borneo's orangutans are at risk of one day disappearing for good.

]]> <![CDATA[AIs, oceans and proteins: Ottawa announces winners of $950 million 'supercluster' competition]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/innovation-superclusters-bains-1.4536551?cmp=rss 1.4536551 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 08:51:22 EST Andy Blatchford News/Technology & Science

The Trudeau government has unveiled the winners of a competition to form technology 'superclusters' — a title that will guarantee the victors a piece of up to $950 million in federal funding.

]]> <![CDATA[Enhancing athletic performance on a genetic level]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/gene-doping-olympics-1.4535719?cmp=rss 1.4535719 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 15:23:01 EST Torah Kachur News/Technology & Science

It’s already on WADA’s radar and gene doping may already be happening to enhance athletes’ performance, but its future is much more problematic.

]]> <![CDATA[Toxic metals from plastic left on the beach are leaching into the ocean's ecosystems: B.C. study]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/british-columbia/metals-from-plastic-are-going-into-the-ocean-study-says-1.4536627?cmp=rss 1.4536627 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 11:33:18 EST CBC News News/Canada/British Columbia

Researchers say tiny particles only millimetres in size can ferry metal into the ecosystem.

]]> <![CDATA[Google's Chrome browser starts blocking 'disruptive' ads]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/ad-blocking-chrome-1.3713568?cmp=rss 1.3713568 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 08:31:40 EST The Associated Press News/Technology & Science

On Thursday, Google will begin using its Chrome browser to eradicate ads it deems annoying or otherwise detrimental to users. It just so happens that many of Google's own most lucrative ads will sail through its new filters.

]]> <![CDATA[Pulsating aurora spotted in Canada helps explain northern lights' origin]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/pulsating-aurora-the-pas-1.4534912?cmp=rss 1.4534912 Wed, 14 Feb 2018 13:00:00 EST Emily Chung News/Technology & Science

Scientists have figured out what causes pulsating auroras, a special type of northern lights that blink in the night sky. And it was partly thanks to a lucky observation of the phenomenon in Canada.

]]> <![CDATA[HQ Trivia game has not-so-trivial Canadian connections]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/world/hq-triva-scott-rogowsky-paul-paquet-canada-connections-1.4512189?cmp=rss 1.4512189 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST Steven D'Souza News/World

HQ Trivia, the internet sensation out of New York City that attracts nearly a million players a game, has a host with a special affinity for Canada and a tie to an Ottawa trivia mastermind.

]]> <![CDATA[Leatherback turtle, not overturned boat, found washed up in Cape Breton]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/nova-scotia/leatherback-turtle-bras-d-or-maclean-dfo-1.4534762?cmp=rss 1.4534762 Wed, 14 Feb 2018 10:44:41 EST Peggy MacDonald News/Canada/Nova Scotia

A 360-kilogram leatherback turtle carcass that washed up near shore in Islandview, Cape Breton, in Nova Scotia, is now on its way to the Department of Fisheries and Oceans lab in Charlottetown for analysis.

]]> <![CDATA[Leaping elk crashes low-flying research helicopter]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/elk-helicopter-crash-1.4534704?cmp=rss 1.4534704 Wed, 14 Feb 2018 08:32:47 EST The Associated Press News/Technology & Science

An elk leaped into a research helicopter that was trying to capture it and brought down the helicopter in a collision that also killed the elk, authorities in Utah said Tuesday.

]]> <![CDATA[Statistics Canada looking down the drain to determine levels of pot consumption]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/statistics-canada-human-waste-pot-1.4534673?cmp=rss 1.4534673 Wed, 14 Feb 2018 07:56:49 EST Levi Garber News/Politics

The federal government is taking a somewhat noxious approach to studying just how much pot Canadians are consuming: researching our sewage.

]]> <![CDATA[Industry of dating sites, apps 'very mature,' but fresh investors still take the leap]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/business-online-dating-1.4533936?cmp=rss 1.4533936 Wed, 14 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST Jacqueline Hansen News/Business

With about 2,000 dating services to choose from in North America and millions of users engaging in them, tales of searching digitally for a successful match — for life, or perhaps just for the night — are now so common they've become an intimate part of the way we live.

]]> <![CDATA[Sperm whale spotted in B.C. strait for 1st time in decades]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/british-columbia/sperm-whale-johnstone-strait-1.4534292?cmp=rss 1.4534292 Tue, 13 Feb 2018 20:30:00 EST Bethany Lindsay News/Canada/British Columbia

A sperm whale has been confirmed on Vancouver Island's eastern coast for the first time since 1984.

]]> <![CDATA[Cyberspy agency defends proposed new powers to go on the offensive]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/cyberaggression-canada-cyberspies-1.4533895?cmp=rss 1.4533895 Tue, 13 Feb 2018 17:20:42 EST The Canadian Press News/Politics

A senior official from Canada's cyberspy agency told a House of Commons committee proposed new powers would allow it to stop a terrorist's mobile phone from detonating a car bomb, block the ability of extremists to communicate, or prevent a foreign power from interfering in the country's democratic process.

]]> <![CDATA[Watch robot skiers race down snowy slopes]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/robot-skiers-1.4533571?cmp=rss 1.4533571 Tue, 13 Feb 2018 14:34:35 EST Reuters News/Technology & Science

While Alpine skiers fought high winds at the Pyeongchang Games on Monday, there were no such problems for robots competing in their own "Olympics" ski challenge.

]]> <![CDATA[All-female fish species shows sex is overrated ]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/amazon-molly-1.4532971?cmp=rss 1.4532971 Tue, 13 Feb 2018 09:08:44 EST Reuters News/Technology & Science

An all-female freshwater fish species called the Amazon molly is living proof that sexual reproduction may be vastly overrated, scientists say after analyzing its DNA.

]]> <![CDATA[Iceland's bitcoin miners will guzzle more energy than its homes in 2018]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/bitcoin-energy-iceland-1.4532930?cmp=rss 1.4532930 Tue, 13 Feb 2018 08:23:54 EST The Associated Press News/Technology & Science

Iceland is expected to use more energy "mining" bitcoins and other virtual currencies this year than it uses to power its homes.

]]> <![CDATA[Trump wants business to take over space station from NASA by 2025]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/trump-space-station-private-business-1.4531843?cmp=rss 1.4531843 Mon, 12 Feb 2018 15:43:07 EST The Associated Press News/Business

The Trump administration wants NASA out of the International Space Station by 2025, and private businesses running the place instead.

]]> <![CDATA[Flight of the hummingbird: How size and wing shape forge fantastic flyers]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/british-columbia/flight-of-the-hummingbird-how-size-and-wing-shape-forge-fantastic-flyers-1.4529578?cmp=rss 1.4529578 Sat, 10 Feb 2018 18:00:00 EST Bethany Lindsay News/Canada/British Columbia

A group of biologists from the University of B.C. braved army ants and driving rain to answer one simple question: What makes hummingbirds such nimble flyers?
